topic.title: Overriding an XSLT Processing Step of the DITA WebHelp Transformation

body.p: Since WebHelp output is primarily obtained by running XSLT transformations over the DITA input files (through the DITA Map WebHelp transformation scenarios), one customization method would be to override the default XSLT templates that are used by the WebHelp transformations.
There are available two methods to override the XSLT stylesheets implied by the WebHelp transformation.

ul.li: The first method is to use one of the WebHelp XSLT-import extension points which allows you to import an XSLT stylesheets in the XSLT stylesheet hierarchy. This method uses the same mechanism with the DITA-OT XSLT-import extension points. Please note that this method will affect all the outputs generated with the WebHelp system.

The second method implies that you will create a DITA-OT extension plugin with a custom transtype. The main difference from the first customization method is that you will not affect all WebHelp transformations, only the transformations that uses the declared plugin transtype will be affected.
